Tachikomaio will get rid of your depende: Tachikoma.io will get rid of your dependency hell. Dependency update is not what you want to do! You want to write application!
Just leave what Tachikomaio can do and d: Just leave what Tachikoma.io can do and do what you want to do.
Everyone knows it is good to continue to: Everyone knows it is good to continue to use the latest libraries/programming language, but what's stopping them?
We know it is good to continue to use: We know it is good to continue to use the latest libraries/programming language. We enjoy new library features, increase in speed, and other benefits. Everyone knows this, but what's stopping them?
I believe it's due to the lack of tools: I believe it's due to the lack of tools and integrations.
Interval pull request is performing auto: Interval pull request is performing automatic, with strategy "Bundler", "David", "Carton" if you set.
What we only do is pressing merge button: What we only do is pressing merge button because this app sends pull request with updating dependencies.
This is a human job that passes test and: This is a human job that passes test and confirms diff.
Not updating the dependent libraries: Not updating the dependent libraries, does not damage the library/application immediately. When adding a new library that you want to use, occurring a security issue in a library which is already in use, it is extremely difficult to find the right version that functions properly with it. Even if you find the right combination, it's very reactionary and it even gets harder when adding the next one.
Furthermore sometimes with an older vers: Furthermore, sometimes with an older version, you won't be able to enjoy new library features, increase in speed, updated version of Ruby/Node.js/etc., and other benefits.
Ultimately choosing the latest stable co: Ultimately, choosing the latest(stable) combination periodically will keep damages to a minimum.
Everyone knows this but whats stopping t: Everyone knows this, but what's stopping them?
I believe it's due to the lack of tools: I believe it's due to the lack of tools and integrations. That is where Tachikoma.io comes in.
We have a plan to support other strategi: We have a plan to support other strategies (languages), but we are not familiar with them, so you are welcome to contribute!
It is free for public repositories: It is free for public repositories, however, requires monthly subscription for private repositories.
